meanings.definition: The production of spores that are all of the same size and shape.
meanings.sent1: Isospory ensures that all spores are uniform in size and shape.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the isospory of the spores under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome complained about the isospory of the mushrooms, wishing for some variety.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the isospory of the fern spores created a mesmerizing pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained isospory as the process of producing identical spores for reproduction.

meanings.definition: The condition of having spores that are all identical in size and shape.
meanings.sent1: The isospory of the plant's spores was remarkable in its uniformity.
meanings.sent2: The botanist marveled at the isospory displayed by the fern species.
meanings.sent3: At the spore party, everyone joked about the isospory, wondering if they were all clones.
meanings.sent4: The isospory of the dandelion seeds symbolized perfect symmetry in nature.
meanings.sent5: The classroom discussion focused on the concept of isospory and its significance in plant biology.
